Posts.Content: May 15, 2012 02:20PM mauimom wrote: Great news!  Hope your appetite comes back soon - you need to be at your fighting weight!
Posts.Title: onc. news apple ma111

Posts.Content: Jun 9, 2012 11:56AM mauimom wrote: I didn't have the decadron before a/c, just taxol.  But I did have extra days of the emend to help with the nausea, along with zofran, compazine and ativan.  I'm kind of a nausea wimp though.  The other thing that helped, although it was a pain to have to go in all the time, was to get iv fluids right after the chemo and then the next couple of days afterwards, too.  Hope you're feeling better soon -

Posts.Content: Aug 31, 2012 03:58PM mauimom wrote: hi - I, too, am getting intrathecal herceptin.  i've had four of six weekly treatments.  for those of you also doing this, do you find that your neck/back area tightens up and is painful for at least two-three days after your treatment?  so far the pain has been the biggest side effect for me.  now we may be adding in a chemo drug intrathecally as well - has anyone had that?  sorry for all the questions...and thank you in advance!

Posts.Content: Oct 26, 2011 10:42PM mauimom wrote: Great news Maria Malta! Just what we like to hear : ) Going for another fill tomorrow - seems I'm going to have to finish the fills before I can start radiation. I just want to get going already - patience is not one of my strengths...
Posts.Title: Any October 2011 Surgeries out there want to wait together? gamergirl GrandmaV

Posts.Content: Nov 3, 2011 12:49AM mauimom wrote: Just wanted to drop by and say hi - I'm hoping that things are going well for our October group.  So much is going on with everyone, it's hard to keep up, but I'm reading what you're all posting.  My thoughts are with you, rejoicing with the good news and offering comfort with the hard things.  I'm waiting for clearance to begin radiation - was hoping to finish my 6.5 weeks before the end of the year, now not thinking that will happen...and I probably have 1-2 more fills left - I'm at 320cc so far with the next one next week.  And thank you to all of you who posted about physical therapy!  It's making a big difference in my arm.  hugs to you all.
Posts.Title: Any October 2011 Surgeries out there want to wait together? gamergirl GrandmaV

Posts.Content: Sep 5, 2012 12:52PM mauimom wrote: I think I'm getting 440 herceptin - the docs are meeting today to discuss adding topotecan to the mix. And whether to do rads to my spine before finishing up the intrathecal stuff. The pain was so bad Monday I had to go in for pain meds and decadron iv. Arachnoiditis I think they said. Good thing my husband was there - I don't know why they tell me anything after giving me morphine. I have to idea what they tell me half the time!

Posts.Content: Oct 6, 2011 07:40PM mauimom wrote: Hi all! I'm two days out over here. Flew home last night and feel so much better to have slept at home rather than the hospital. I had a right side mast with a TE placement. Pain is manageable with the drugs. Because of the travel last night I got a little behind on it and learned that staying on top of the pain is key! As others have said, don't be a hero - take those drugs! Hugs to all, we will make it through this.

Posts.Content: Oct 16, 2011 07:54AM mauimom wrote: Kelleyod, I am a uni with TE, too...I was off the percocet on day 6, but I was having some sideceffects they thought were related to it. Since then, the pain isn't too bad but I feel like I tire easily and can tell if I overdo it and will need to rest up. Basically, I've been trying to do more each day but there have been some days that are frustrating. With three little ones, I have to consciously hold back a lot. I agree that the TE is uncomfortable since it was filled during surgery. I don't have my next until the beginning of the month thankfully. Keep us posted and hope the healing is progressing!

Posts.Content: Oct 1, 2011 09:33AM - edited Oct 2, 2011 05:10AM by mauimom I'm a little late to the party, but am scheduled for Tuesday the 4th - finished neo-adjuvant chemo August 15, was originally scheduled for surgery earlier this month but now we're on for Tuesday.  So, here's hoping (sounds strange but I want to get this over with already!) that Tuesday goes off without a hitch... All the best to all of you in this fight.

Posts.Content: Oct 8, 2011 07:44AM mauimom wrote: Just wanted to add some good news out there...my path report came back with a full response - no sign of the nastiness! I had neo-adjuvant chemo (12 weeks of taxol and herceptin and 4 rounds of dose dense AC). There's still a long road ahead but this feels huge. The chemo was worth it!
